intro: Eremodaucus lehmannii, commonly known as the desert holly, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant features fleshy, spiny leaves that help reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Its yellow or orange flowers bloom in late spring or early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Eremodaucus lehmannii is well adapted to harsh desert conditions, making it a resilient and drought-tolerant species.
